column2: NEVADA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: NV

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column6: they must change lane immediately.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 2. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column4: yield to all trains at the crossing.
column6: speed up to beat the train.
column8: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.

column2: 3. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column6: reserved for blind people.
column8: directly behind them.

column2: 4. On two-lane, two-way streets or highways, you should start left turns close to the center line.
column6: False

column2: 5. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column6: maintain focus toward the left of the road.
column8: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column10: stare straight ahead at all times.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: No right turn
column8: No parking

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column6: No right turn
column8: Exit

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: A left turn can be made only after stopping
column6: Right turn is not permitted
column8: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection

column2: 9. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column6: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column8: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column10: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column6: Merging Traffic
column8: Wrong Way

column2: 11. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column6: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column8: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.

column2: 12. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column10: increase your speed and move to the left.

column2: 13. Before backing up, you should:
column6: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.
column8: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column10: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.

column2: 14. Motorcyclists are entitled to use the full width of a traffic lane; therefore, a driver should pass a motorcycle the same way as passing another vehicle.
column6: True

column2: 15. The best way to avoid loss of control in wet conditions is pump your brakes.
column6: False

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column6: Slippery road ahead
column8: Traffic increases ahead

column2: 18. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Not drinking over a period of time.
column6: Eating before or while you drink.
column8: Drinking coffee.

column2: 19. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column6: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.

column2: 20. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
column6: curves right, then left.
column8: is a divided highway.

column2: 21. This sign means:
column6: The road will curve to the right.
column8: Do not turn right.
column10: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 22. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column6: you must wait for the red light to turn green.
column8: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column6: Winding road ahead
column8: Wrong Way

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column6: Railroad Warning
column8: Stop if necessary

column2: 25. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column6: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column8: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column10: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.

column2: 26. This sign means:
column6: Warning: sharp left turn ahead.
column8: Hairpin corner ahead.

column2: 27. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
column6: white
column8: black

column2: 28. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.
column6: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.
column8: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.
column10: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.

column2: 29. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column6: vehicles from the right.
column8: pedestrians only.

column2: 30. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column6: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column8: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column10: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.

column2: 31. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column6: Always.
column8: Never.
column10: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column6: Winding road ahead
column8: Low ground railroad crossing

column2: 33. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column6: for yeild signs.
column8: exclusively for stop signs.
column10: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 34. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column6: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: come to a complete stop.

column2: 35. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column6: The bus is about to stop.
column8: You must pass the school bus.
column10: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.

column2: 36. This sign means:
column6: Warning: U-turn ahead.
column8: Right turns not allowed.

column2: 37. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.

column2: 38. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column6: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column8: Open the side window so you can see.

column2: 39. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.
column6: they cannot go straight ahead.
column8: U-turns are now allowed.

column2: 40. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column6: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column8: the condition and type of vehicle tires.

column2: 41. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column8: Rounabout rules apply.
column10: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.

column2: 42. You should increase your following distance when:
column6: following a motorcycle.
column8: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.

column2: 43. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column6: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column8: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column10: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.

column2: 44. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column6: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.
column8: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.

column2: 45. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column6: an advance warning sign.
column8: a speed limit sign.

column2: 46. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column6: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column8: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column10: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.

column2: 47. This road sign means:
column6: Right lane closed
column8: Multiple Turns

column2: 48. This road sign means:
column6: A road joins from the left
column8: Sharp right turn
column10: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left

column2: 49. Aggressive driving includes:
column6: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column8: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 50. Who is most at risk?
column6: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column8: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.
